summary: This document is an email chain from May 2019 between a federal prosecutor (USANYS) and an FBI Special Agent regarding the drafting and service of subpoenas to telecommunications providers (AT&T, T-Mobile, Verizon, Sprint) for subscriber information related to phone numbers from 2003-2005. The context suggests this is part of an investigation into human trafficking.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York
persons.context: The FBI agent is corresponding with a federal prosecutor about obtaining subscriber information from telecom providers for an investigation, likely related to human trafficking.

events.title: Email exchange regarding telecom subpoenas
events.description: An FBI Special Agent and a federal prosecutor exchange emails about obtaining subscriber information from telecom providers for phone numbers from 2003-2005.

events.title: Request to serve subpoenas and check for overlaps
events.description: A federal prosecutor requests service of attached subpoenas to telecom providers and asks to check for any overlaps with a flagged person.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from April-May 2019 regarding subpoenas for telecom subscriber records.
The investigation involves phone numbers from 2003 to 2005, indicating a historical lookback period.
The FBI agent's signature block references 'Human Trafficking', linking the telecom records request to a human trafficking investigation.
The prosecutor requests checking for 'overlaps' with a flagged person, suggesting a specific target of interest.
Multiple telecom providers are mentioned: AT&T, T-Mobile, Verizon Wireless, Sprint Spectrum.
